body_html:
Interesting. I can reproduce this. The following script demonstrates buggy behavior in TensorBoard:

import tensorflow as tf

def main():
  k = tf.constant(0)
  tf.summary.scalar('loss', k)
  tf.summary.scalar('loss/regularization', k)
  tf.summary.scalar('loss_extra_stuff', k)
  summ = tf.summary.merge_all()

  sess = tf.Session()
  writer = tf.summary.FileWriter('/tmp/cat2')
  writer.add_graph(sess.graph)
  writer.add_summary(sess.run(summ))
  writer.close()

if __name__ == '__main__':
  main()

Thank you for reporting. I've migrated this to our new repository at tensorflow/tensorboard#41.

body:
Interesting. I can reproduce this. The following script demonstrates buggy behavior in TensorBoard:

```py
import tensorflow as tf

def main():
  k = tf.constant(0)
  tf.summary.scalar('loss', k)
  tf.summary.scalar('loss/regularization', k)
  tf.summary.scalar('loss_extra_stuff', k)
  summ = tf.summary.merge_all()

  sess = tf.Session()
  writer = tf.summary.FileWriter('/tmp/cat2')
  writer.add_graph(sess.graph)
  writer.add_summary(sess.run(summ))
  writer.close()

if __name__ == '__main__':
  main()
```

Thank you for reporting. I've migrated this to our new repository at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/issues/41.
